definition: to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance

sentences.english: This is an opportunity that should not be missed.
Carlin's book came as a godsend to the 72-year-old actor.
sentences.chinese: 對於這位72歲的演員，卡林的書不啻是個天賜良機。

sentences.english: Take it easy, but take it.
sentences.chinese: 放輕鬆，但是不要錯失良機。

sentences.english: Please make up your mind / make your decision as early as possible / you can, or you’ll miss the good / golden chance / opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 請儘早做出決定，不然你會坐失良機。

sentences.english: That will be the time to re-allocate a larger share to emerging markets.
sentences.chinese: 那時就是將更多資產配置到新興市場的良機了。

sentences.english: This time the opportunity presented what he fatuously termed to himself 'cinch.
sentences.chinese: 他把這一次機會愚蠢地自稱爲“天賜良機”。

sentences.english: Asia will have another reason to make its own machinery.
sentences.chinese: 受此影響，亞洲自己的機械工業將迎來發展良機。

sentences.english: It was a missed opportunity as well.
sentences.chinese: 它還是一個錯失的良機。

sentences.english: One of the biggest mistakes in one´s life is to miss the boat.
sentences.chinese: 人生最大的錯誤之一就是坐失良機。

sentences.english: Sinclair also just missed the target when one on one with the goalkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 辛克萊爾同樣在禁區裏1對1時錯失良機。

sentences.english: So, get yourself prepared, and don't miss the boat .
sentences.chinese: 因此，你得好好準備，可不要坐失良機。

sentences.english: Don't falter in your resolve, or you will miss the chance in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 別再躊躇不決了，否則你會錯過這次良機。

sentences.english: I'll take a risk, Take a chance, Make a change, And breakaway…
sentences.chinese: 我會去冒險，會把握良機，做出改變然後破繭而出。

sentences.english: He cannot but let the chance slip through his fingers when offered a good job.
sentences.chinese: 儘管有人提供了一份好工作，但他只好坐失良機。

sentences.english: Indecision can also result in missed opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 優柔寡斷還可以導致痛失良機。

sentences.english: He goofed up one opportunity after another.

definition: extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to borrow sb's authority/to seize an opportunity
railtrack connection/to integrate into sth/to dock/to connect/to be in step with/to bring into line with/to align
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
profitable to both sides/a win-win situation
